result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik Aguayo

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 5, 2023 at 08:45 am.

10:43 AM Defendant Erik Aguayo appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court for Erik Aguayo.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Atty Pribyl indicates defendant still in treatment, received offer from state, requests status.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:15 PM   Defendant Erik Aguayo appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court for Erik Aguayo.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of prior hearing that was done without the court reporter and what happened at that hearing.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.   Atty Pribyl requests a status in 60 days as defendant is currently in treatment and isn't sure when his treatment will be finished.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:54 AM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Erik Aguayo in court.   Court reviews events in file, reviews petition for appointment of counsel form filed by defendant this morning.  Court reviews petition, appoints Atty Matt Pribyl to represent defendant.  Defendant to pay $100 per month with first payment due by 7/31/22.  Atty Pribyl is due in court at 11 am this morning, advises defendant to hang around and meet with Atty Pribyl so we can proceed with case today. Back in session 10:31 am.  Defendant present in court with Atty Matthew Pribyl.  Atty Pribyl accepts court appointment.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Bond remains in effect.  Court approves zoom appearance for defendant for 9/01/22 hearing. (Hearing starting at 10:31 was done off the record as court reporter was not present in the courtroom)
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

10:45 AM     Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Erik Aguayo in court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant indicates he does not qualify for SPD, requests court appointed attorney.  Defendant to fill out petition for appointment of attorney form and file it with the court prior to next hearing. Court questions defendant on address/employment. Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
